summary: A letter from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to Judge Alison J. Nathan detailing an incident at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Brooklyn where guards confiscated and reviewed Ghislaine Maxwell's confidential legal documents and intimidated her by standing over her while she used the bathroom. The letter alleges violations of Maxwell's Sixth Amendment rights and requests court intervention.

events.title: Legal Visit and Document Confiscation
events.description: During a scheduled in-person legal conference at MDC Brooklyn, guards confiscated Ghislaine Maxwell's confidential legal documents after her attorneys left, accusing her of improperly retaining documents given by counsel.

events.title: Bathroom Intimidation Incident
events.description: After the document confiscation, a guard stood knee-to-knee with Ghislaine Maxwell while she used the commode in a small bathroom, denying her privacy and causing her to feel intimidated and humiliated.

events.title: Court Letter Filed
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim filed this letter with Judge Alison J. Nathan reporting the MDC incidents and requesting court intervention to obtain information and protect Maxwell's rights.

keyFacts: MDC guards confiscated and reviewed Ghislaine Maxwell's confidential legal documents, which included materials subject to a protective order and attorney-client privilege.
A guard stood over Maxwell while she used the bathroom, which she described as intimidating and humiliating.
The defense alleges the incident violated Maxwell's Sixth Amendment right to effective assistance of counsel by chilling attorney-client communication and breaching confidentiality.
The defense demanded the identity of the guards involved, an inventory of seized items, and confirmation of whether documents were duplicated.
The document shows heightened tension and alleged misconduct in Maxwell's pre-trial detention, impacting her ability to prepare for trial.
